title: How to Do Street Photography

steps.headline: Use digital, if at all possible.
steps.description: This way you won't have to worry about the cost of the film and getting it developed.

steps.headline: Get your lens.
steps.description: You will want at least 2 (or a pretty good zoom). Have a wide angle lens and a telephoto lens. That is, of course, if you have an SLR. If you don't, use what you have. Cell phones and point and shoot cameras are getting better all the time.

steps.headline: Find out your camera's hyperfocal distance.
steps.description: This is the closest distance setting for which subjects at infinity are still acceptably sharp. That will take some playing around, but it will improve your shots.

steps.headline: If you are using a wide angle lens, try pre-focusing.
steps.description: Since these lens have such a great depth of field, just about everything is in focus. That way, you don't have to focus with each individual shot.

steps.headline: Decide if you are going to be up front and let everyone know you are photographing or if you want to be sneaky about it.
steps.description: Keep in mind that, in today's world, being sneaky about it can be a bit dangerous, and being public about it also has its own set of risks.

steps.headline: Don't just sit down.
steps.description: Walk around. Check out store fronts, reflections, look up, look down, look everywhere. If you wait for a photo op to come to you, you may be waiting a long time.

steps.headline: Pay attention to how other's feel about you photographing them and just photographing.
steps.description: You never know who might have been stalked in the past and could be very concerned about being watched. If someone is at all uncomfortable, don't do it.

steps.headline: Do your best to blend in.
steps.description: People will feel much more comfortable with you if you don't stand out.

Find out your camera's hyperfocal distance. This is the closest distance setting for which subjects at infinity are still acceptably sharp. That will take some playing around, but it will improve your shots. If you are using a wide angle lens, try pre-focusing. Keep in mind that, in today's world, being sneaky about it can be a bit dangerous, and being public about it also has its own set of risks. Don't just sit down. Walk around. Check out store fronts, reflections, look up, look down, look everywhere. If you wait for a photo op to come to you, you may be waiting a long time.
